item.title: Austria’s Hills Are Still Alive, 60 Years Later
item.description: In Salzburg, an anniversary of “The Sound of Music” looks grand through a child’s eyes, even if the locals are gazing elsewhere.

item.title: What to Know About Jimmy Lai’s Trial in Hong Kong
item.description: The media tycoon, jailed since 2020, ran a now-defunct newspaper that was critical of the government.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s Freedom May Now Hinge on Beijing and Trump
item.description: As the outspoken Hong Kong publisher awaits a verdict, his trial has become a test of China’s resolve to crush dissent, and of whether President Trump...

item.title: After Blocking U.N. Nuclear Watchdog, Iran Allows Inspectors to Return
item.description: Iran halted cooperation with the agency last month, as experts warned that Tehran might revive efforts to build a nuclear bomb.

item.title: Germany Proposes Plan to Boost Recruitment or Resort to Draft
item.description: Some detractors think the new bill is too weak to fill the recruitment gap. Others worry it will inevitably lead to forced conscription.
